resume_professionnel: To secure a full time Combustion Engineer position applying strong fundamentals for application, research, and development in the areas of Combustion and Fluids and Thermal Sciences and other allied Mechanical Engineering related functions

missions: Familiarized with & utilized ASME Engineering Design, Drafting & Documentation Standards
Provided support to the engineering team in developing conceptual layout drawings
Performed various engineering studies to obtain the simplest and most efficient engineering solution for Pressure Vessel design and piping design and specification
Developed drawings, schematics and P&ID's using AutoCAD Mechanical and Microstation according to ANSI Document Control & Management System for electronic as well as hard copy documents
Coordinated the organizing, scanning, retrieval and distribution of engineering documents for Project Managers
Designed and successfully operated a Compact Inserts Drying Machine
Researched past techniques used for drying of inserts to identify flaws and consolidated ideas in a team of three to eliminate these flaws
Designed a pneumatic cylinder to lift the cabinet door using a Direction Control Valve
Modelled an aesthetically good looking cabinet head using Pro/Engineer (Pro/E)
Calculated required heat transfer rates and air flow rates for selection of SILVENT air nozzle and KANTHAL air heater
Increased production rate by 16.67%, reduced cycle time by 1 minute and floor area by 61.87%
Reduced overall power consumption increasing profit by Rs. 426,336 per annum
Learned about Fixed and Rotary Wing Aircraft Engines and their thermodynamics
Exposed to turbo machines (e.g., Gas Turbines) and application of fluid mechanics and heat transfer concepts
Training included avionics and accessories and MRO (Manufacture, Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul) activities
Hands-on experience with Lathe, Drill, Mill and CNC Machine
Sponsored by New York State Energy Research and Development Authority (NYSERDA) as a part of advanced innovative energy solutions
Reviewed existing literature on different pyrolysis models used to characterize biomass
Performed heating experiments using a DSC-TGA to study the pyrolysis of BioBlock
Using TGA, calculated kinetic parameters like activation energy and rate constant from mass vs temperature and derivative of mass loss vs temperature curves
Determined heat of pyrolysis and specific heat using heat flow vs temperature and derivative curves from DSC
Created a decomposition model based on the experimental results

projets.titre: Solving Non-Linear Euler Equation for Gas Dynamics using CFD tools
projets.description: Solution for the Euler equation for Gas Dynamics obtained using First Order Lax Friedrich Scheme, Runge-Kutta Fourth Order - TVD Scheme and Lax Wendroff Method; compared fundamental properties of the schemes, presented solutions and concluded on relative accuracy.

projets.titre: Numerical solution to the Prandtl-Glauert equation for inviscid, non-heat conducting perfect gas free flow
projets.description: Solved the Wave Equation using Successive Over-Relaxation and Alternating Direction methods; discussed grid generation and compared analytical and numerical results.

projets.titre: FBG Sensors in Oil/Gas Permanent Downhole Measurement Applications
projets.description: Analyzed use of FBG Sensors for permanent downhole measurement applications, studied sensing mechanism and summarized findings in a report and PowerPoint presentation.
Presented a seminar as part of coursework discussing basic concepts, principle of operation, advantages, limitations and unique applications of closed-ended oscillating heat pipe.

projets.titre: Pyrolysis of BioBlock and decomposition model
projets.description: Performed DSC-TGA heating experiments on BioBlock, extracted kinetic parameters from TGA data, determined heat of pyrolysis and specific heat from DSC, and developed a decomposition model based on experimental results.

Designed and operated a compact inserts drying machine; researched prior techniques, collaborated in a team of three to address flaws, and implemented design improvements increasing production and reducing footprint and power consumption.

engagements: Student Member: Society of Automotive Engineers (May 2010 - May 2013)
Presented paper 'Alternate Fuels in IC Engine' at PVG College of Engineering, Pune (2011)
Presented paper 'Removal of Toxic Metals from Wastewater by Activated Carbon from Agro-Industrial By-Product' at MMM College of Engineering, Pune (2011)
